overview_of_class:
AFST 390-0-20 "Politics of Africa", Prof. Jeff Rice, Winter 2016 (combined with Poli_Sci 359)

In this class we will focus on the present day cycle of economic and political collapse in some African states and the necessity of international humanitarian or military intervention. This will be followed by some nation's recovery in terms of economic growth and political stability. Case studies will include Ethiopia, Rwanda, Sudan, amongst possible others.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
AFST 390-0-20 "Politics of Africa", Prof. Jeff Rice, Winter 2016 (combined with Poli_Sci 359)

In this class we will focus on the present day cycle of economic and political collapse in some African states and the necessity of international humanitarian or military intervention. This will be followed by some nation's recovery in terms of economic growth and political stability. Case studies will include Ethiopia, Rwanda, Sudan, amongst possible others.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
1) To identify trends such as democratization, conflict, conflict resolution, economic collapse and recovery,
2) To recognize the complexity of such issues as 'Responsibility To Protect as a policy as distinct from an idea.
3) To recognize the facts and fallacies of the role of ethnicity in African conflict and post conflict resolution.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Two take home midterms worth 20% each. One short book review worth 10%, one take home final worth 40% and participation (10%).
